Class SokobanMapGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • SokobanMapGenerator

  • public class SokobanMapGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    The SokobanMapGenerator class provides scenarios for the Sokoban game. The provided Sokoban maps are composed by a boolean matrix representing the occupiable positions, a set of goal positions, a set of box positions in the given map, the player's intial position, the number of columns and rows of a given level and the total number of levels available.

      static boolean[][] getOccupiableMap(int level)
      Returns a matrix of boolean values representing the walkable positions in the map; walls are marked with false and walkable positions are marked with true.
      static int[] getPlayer(int level)
      Returns the player's initial position in the given level.
      static int numberOfLevels()
      Returns the number of levels available.

    • Method Detail

      • getOccupiableMap

        public static boolean[][] getOccupiableMap(int level)
        Returns a matrix of boolean values representing the walkable positions in the map; walls are marked with false and walkable positions are marked with true.
        Parameters:
        level - given level
        Returns:
        matrix identifying walkable positions in the map with true and walls with false
        Ensures:
        \result.length==getNrRows(level) && \result.length[i].length==getNrColumns(level), 0 <= i < \result.length

        Returns:
        number of rows of the map in the given level
        Ensures:
        \result > 2

        Returns:

        Ensures:

      • numberOfLevels

        public static int numberOfLevels()
        Returns the number of levels available.
        Returns:
        the number of levels available in the generator
        Ensures:
        \return >= 1;

      • getGoals

        public static int[][] getGoals(int level)
        Returns the array of goal positions in the given level.
        Parameters:
        level - given level
        Returns:
        matrix representing the list of goal positions in the given level
        Ensures:
        \result!=null && \result.length > 0 && 0 <= \result[i][0] < getNrRows(level) && 0 <= \result[i][1] < getNrColumns(level) && \result[i].length == 2, 0 <= i < \result.length

      • getPlayer

        public static int[] getPlayer(int level)
        Returns the player's initial position in the given level.
        Parameters:
        level - given level
        Returns:
        array with the player position
        Ensures:
        \result.length==2 && 0 <= \result[0] < getNrRows(level) && 0 <= \result[1] < getNrColumns(level)

      • getBoxes

        public static int[][] getBoxes(int level)
        Returns the array of box positions in the given level.
        Parameters:
        level - given level
        Returns:
        matrix representing the list of box positions in the given level
        Ensures:
        \result!=null && \result.length > 0 && \result.length == getGoals(level).length && 0 <= \result[i][0] < getNrRows(level) && 0 <= \result[i][1] < getNrColumns(level) && \result[i].length == 2, 0 <= i < \result.length
